secret_rule: Only items that are typically associated with a traditional beach day can be brought to the picnic.

Excellent progression of evidence! After carefully analyzing all the allowed items, here's my final rule guess:

The rule seems to be: "Items typically used for OUTDOOR LEISURE or RECREATIONAL activities"

The evidence supporting this rule includes:
- Beach-specific items (beach towel, surfboard, beach chair, beach umbrella, beach ball)
- Water/beach sports equipment (snorkel, flippers)
- Sun protection items (sunscreen, sunglasses)
- Outdoor comfort/convenience items (cooler, picnic basket)

What unites these items is not just being beach-related, but being things people would use to enjoy leisure time outside - whether at a beach, park, picnic, or other outdoor recreational setting.

The rule isn't strictly about beaches, but about items that enhance outdoor recreational experiences. The common thread is "things that make outdoor leisure more comfortable, fun, or enjoyable."

My confidence in this rule is very high, given the systematic testing and consistent pattern across multiple item types. I believe this captures the underlying principle governing what can be brought in the game.
